Choose your card wisely, then wager victory points to gain the advantage over your competition.

The game of rock, paper, scissors has been played in various forms for hundreds of years. That's Mine is a fast paced time filler game that adapts this enduring mechanic to a card game. It adds support for more than two players and introduces a risk/reward wagering element.

Each round involves all players choosing a numbered card with rock, paper or scissors and resolving battle as expected. Things get interesting when players wager existing victory points to influence when they enter the competition. Every hand is resolved leaving only one winner with a simple yet decisive tiebreaking system.

Each wager builds the kitty and the survivor exclaims "That's Mine" while claiming their winnings.

169576.name: Ritratto d'Autore: capolavori al Maschile
169576.description: Experience the thrill of making a single framework, bizarre and imaginative, borrowing the mustachioed smile Gauguin or Van Gogh's restless gaze to achieve a Bacchus certainly more extravagant than that of Caravaggio. But the game does not last long because to win the game then you have to make a genuine portrait, paying tribute to the great masters such as Raphael and Picasso, and composing their own portraits. You have to search in different areas of the game puzzle missing to complete your portrait, and the 10-sided die will tell you if you can take them freely, or you have to challenge your opponent in a feud with the nuts, or you will have to answer a question right on portrait you want to dial or the Artist who painted it ... The questions on Art and its Masters are more than four hundred, and were divided between questions Difficulty standard and ... questions "for the little ones", specially designed to accompany children to the discovery of Art. With "Portrait d'Autore, masterpieces to Male 'gaming experience encompasses a mix of different emotions. The good fortune of being able to identify and take the missing pieces joins skill in answering questions, and everything blends the fun and imagination. The different portraits that will consist in the match, one of the most curious of the other, will not fail to arouse continuous emotions and feelings in the players. The main objective of the Game and what to discover the art and his most famous portraits, while stimulating the observation and discovery, fantasy and imagination, through the magic of a Portrait of the Author that is gradually becoming ... a true portrayal! Portrait of author also proposes to transfer to the players some knowledge of art history, through a lot of questions about the artists, their works, and on Art in general, which sometimes require the observation and research of the details: even children will learn in a spontaneous and always fun, challenging each other with questions to measure ... baby!

169578.name: Novela: il gioco della soap opera
169578.description: What horrible secret is hidden by Reginald, the most popular model in the world? Who will get the post of president of the superglobal Inc., the industry's most powerful of the earth? And above all ... be able to marry Miriam and Max, surpassing the perfidious machinations tramate behind them? Novela is the first board game that lets you play as the protagonists of a soap opera or telenovela, living with their stories of fame, money, love and power. All players must reach their three purposes secrets ... by all means! Every game is a real adventure: constant twists, alliances, betrayals, intrigue and fascinate those who follow the pitfalls of the TV serial and will allow those who do not stand to take a good revenge on Ridge, JR and companions. Novela rules are very simple, but the commitment of the game depends only players who can turn a game in the most fun, intriguing and fun RPG.

169579.name: Crossy Road

videogamehonor.38953: 2014 AGD Awards Excellence In Art Nominee

169579.description:
Developed by Matt Hall (@klicktock), Andy Sim (@jigxorandy), and Ben Weatherall (@sunraheadgear), Crossy Road is a twist on a classic, "Frogger". Starting with a chicken, players must hop their character across roads teaming with cars and trucks, rivers with floating logs, and railroad tracks with running trains. Don't stop too long or an eagle may join the fun. There is no goal, other than your last best score.

Players can customize their experience by purchasing new characters in a gumball machine using coins earned in game or received as free gifts. (Of course, you can earn more by watching commercials. There are 50 characters and each one adds a bit of flair and sometimes changes the setting like a penguin that changes everything to snow.

(User Summary)

More information at the Publisher website: http://www.crossyroad.com

169581.name: Cardles: Cards in Puzzle
169581.description:
You can cross the Cardles in order to discover new games/
With Cardles you can play cards in a completely new original way. The game contains two bunch of Cardles with which, taking advantage of the innovation of the crossings, they can be used to adapt classic card games or to create new games, especially crafted to use these special cards.

Buying this game you actually buy two bunch of jigsaw puzzle cards.
The book “Twenty and more games with the Cardles” in detail describe the rules of many games, between which the games of combination like 40 Scale and Machiavelli, some varying of Domino, the games for children like Rubamazzetto and One, let alone many solitary ones, all returned still more exciting thanks to the particularitity of the crossings.
Cardles is a particularly apt game to all the lovers of the cards, children, boys or adults, that they will remain bewitched from the new look and the inusuale format regarding the familiar cards. The visual impact of the Cardles is of sure effect, because every piece of the jigsaw puzzle contain the image of a card, included the Jokers, the figures, and the Ace of Spades “signed” like in the bunch of traditional cards.

169582.name: Idiom Link
169582.description:
English description:

Idiom Link is played with a thirty-six grid square dial. Players have to make words. Each word has to start with the last character of the previous word.

Chinese description:
「連線字龍」遊戲為ＭＪ工作室所設計的中文成語填字遊戲。(ＭＪ工作室成員為Michael Lou樓齊賢、Jack Li李子建)
「連線字龍」遊戲是由三十六個格子所組成的方形字盤，字盤中置入了十個「字龍文字」，可組合成三組頭尾相接的成語，就是後一個成語的頭一個字必須與前一個成語的最後一個字相同（例：「花言巧語」的「語」，接「語重心長」的「語」）。請根據字盤中十個字龍文字的提示，先確定可組合成那三組頭尾相接的成語；再將字盤中的十個字龍文字按照三組成語的頭尾順序，在線條不交錯、格子不重覆的方式下，用一條線將字盤中的三十六個格子全數串連起來（即以第一組成語的頭一個字為起點，第三組成語的最後一個字為終點），即可完成極具高難度的「連線字龍」遊戲。

169583.description:
4 Event cards plus 1 operation card

Abstract from the Asylum-Website:
These are the Promo cards for the new Polis: Fight for the Hegemony edition.
There are 4 new Event cards in the set:

Megarian Decree
Destruction of Plataea
The Battle of Dipaea
Thucydides Concludes “History of the Peloponnesian War”
169583.name: Polis: Fight for the Hegemony – Promotional Events

169584.name: Cowboys & Gunslingers
169584.description: A miniatures skirmish system for Reaper Miniature's wild west line of figures using modified Warlord rules which employ initiative cards and randomly drawn skills to make each encounter different.

169585.name: European Ship Simulator
169585.description:
Captain a wide variety of vessels from a speeding power boat, a humble tug to a luxury cruise liner. Sail highly detailed ships, fight against realistic water physics and take in spectacular vistas as you navigate across famous European ports.

Source: The Publisher Website.

169586.name: The Translation Codex
169586.description:
From publisher blurb:

REALMS BUILT ON THE BLEED OF FICTION!

The Strange holds more worlds than you can imagine. Few have explored more than a handful of these intriguing and dangerous tiny universes.

The Translation Codex provides the sum of years of work recursing around The Strange by Dr. Erica Prethus. The doctor’s discoveries, while controversial, represent the fullest existing accounting of the various recursions around Earth, as well as the various powers that Strangers gain when translating.

Containing 100 Foci (each on its own easily printable page) and 18 new recursions, The Translation Codex is a must have for those who would plumb the depths of the nearby cosmos of recursions and Strange. PCs and GMs wanting to build worlds from their favorite fictions and tropes will find this tome essential and thought provoking.

169587.name: The Portsmouth Mermaid

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

169587.description:
From publisher blurb:

If H. P. Lovecraft didn’t have Hans Christian Andersen’s depiction of the Sea Witch’s dwelling (from The Little Mermaid) in mind when he penned Dagon, he should have.

The Portsmouth Mermaid takes place over the twelve days of a Yuletide Celebration in the town of Portsmouth, north of Westlake. The adventure is largely political, with several factions, all of which have a different optimal outcome. The PCs have to figure out what is going on, decide what to do about it, and then live with the consequences.

A Dungeon Crawl Classics adventure for 4-8 level 2 characters by Daniel J. Bishop.

169588.name: Costumes
169588.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the second part of the Superhero Kit, a series of publications designed around helping you to create a superhero, or to help fill in the blanks in an existing PC or NPC.

This part covers the costume that almost every hero has and sometimes needs to protect their real life identity against those would stand against them (or their loved ones) or do them harm.

This generator, or series of charts, is designed to help flesh out any needed details you require. Use all of them or just one; they are entirely optional.

Inside this part of the kit you find example of :

Accessories
Adornments & Logo
Arms & Legs
Belt
Boots and Shoes
Cape
Chest/Torso
Glove and hands
Hats, Helmets & Head Gear
Masks
Shoulders
Colours
Logo Ideas
Example Special properties

169589.name: Companies & Carpools: Storytelling in the Banal World of Insignificant Humans
169589.description:
From publisher blurb:

Yes, you too can pretend to be one of the Cthulhu mythos, playing a role-playing game about pretending to be normal humans stuck in dead-end jobs, and cheating with eldritch powers to succeed.

169590.name: Hei$t
169590.description:
From Introduction:

It was supposed to be the heist of the decade. Millions in loot, untraceable, untouchable, and it all worked like a charm.

Except now that everyone’s back at the hideout, the loot is all missing. All of it.

One of youse is a backstabbing traitor, or worse, a snitch. And none of youse is gonna leave here alive if you can’t cough up the cash...’cuz Vinnie will demand his due, in blood if not money.

169591.description:
Set in 8th century Northern Britain, Before Scotland: 750 AD - Kingdoms is a tactical combat deck building strategy game. It is historical in nature with a rich context and set of mechanics drawn from original sources.

The game begins in 750 AD and lets you play as one of four nations who struggle for supremacy: the Angles, Britons, Gaels, or Picts. After choosing a leader and moral cause that give special abilities to your kingdom, each player draws up to 7 random cards from their Kingdom Reserve deck. They travel through the Environment and scout the Terrain at the battlefield; these are event cards that alter the impending engagement. From the cards-in-hand (i.e. the Warband), each player may select up to 3 Warband Unit cards that face-off with a competing kingdom. After a simultaneous reveal, cards are resolved one-versus-one with additional Supply, Tactics, or Training cards from the Warband that are used to modify the encounter. Winning cards enter the Hoard. Losing cards are flushed into the Barrow. The game ends when the Kingdom Reserves are exhausted and the player with the largest hoard wins.

This game is targeted at the casual gamer and is a gateway to the more in-depth title Before Scotland: 750 AD - Empires which layers in a working economy and geographic constraints.
169591.name: Before Scotland: 750 AD – Kingdoms

169592.name: Princess Provocateur
169592.description:
From Introduction:

Since ancient times, demonic overlords and megalomaniacal wizards have kidnapped princesses to further their nefarious plots, hiding them away in trapped towers, mysterious mazes,
or dangerous dungeons. When all hope seemed lost, a hero would appear to defeat the villain and win glory, wealth, and the heart of the princess...it was tradition, after all.

Well, you know what? Tradition stinks. Here you are, stuck in a dank cell with a few other princesses, sitting on moldy straw in cold, unsanitary conditions, awaiting some foolhardy,
so-called “hero,” who for all you know may already by dead! Besides which, you and the other princesses aren’t so keen on being treated as a prize.

You aren’t the princesses of yore – each of you is capable in your own right. You don’t need a hero to save the day. Most of these guards look like pushovers, anyway. If a barbarian, a kid with a funny hat, or a pair of mustachioed plumbers can defeat a villain, why can’t a bunch of princesses who have been schooled in fencing, problem-solving, and leadership?

Time to kick tradition in the butt.

Using mechanics similar to Heist, this game turns fairy tales on their ear, as not-so-helpless princesses tell the story of how they escaped the clutches of the villain-of-the-week, all whilst avoiding the irritating and domineering hero.

169593.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pack contains various maps from AdventureAWeek.com and is suitable for use in your favorite virtual tabletop!

169610.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pack contains various maps from AdventureAWeek.com and is suitable for use in your favorite virtual tabletop!

169611.description:
Love Letter: The Hobbit – The Battle of the Five Armies is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players based on the original Love Letter game by Seiji Kanai. The deck consists of 17 cards, with the Arkenstone being valued #8, Bilbo Baggins #7, and so on down to The One Ring at #0.

In each round, each player starts with only one card in hand; one card is removed from play. On a turn, you draw one card, and play one card, using the power on that card to expose others and (possibly) knock them out of the round. If you're the final player active in the round or the player with the highest card when the deck runs out, then you score a point. In LL: The Hobbit, The One Ring does nothing during play, but it counts as a #7 when the game ends, possibly leading to a tie should someone else hold Bilbo.

In addition to the one extra card, LL: The Hobbit differs from the original game in that the Baron (#3) is represented by two separate cards: Tauriel and Legolas. When you use an elf's power to compare cards, Tauriel knocks out the player with the higher valued card while Legolas targets the lower valued card. (This change isn't in the German edition, where Legolas and Tauriel have the same text.)

Whoever first wins 4-7 rounds, with the number dependent on the number of players, wins the game!
169611.name: Love Letter: The Hobbit – The Battle of the Five Armies

169612.name: Infected Zombie
169612.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the Infected Zombie Hordes to Your Savage Worlds Game

Is your Savage Worlds game missing the infected zombie hordes you've always dreamed of?

This release of Monster Brief provides game stats on the Infected Zombie, a creature returned from the dead to eat brains and spread its infection to the living.

Includes the infected zombie template so you can transform any creature into an infected member of the undead, along with example infected zombie civilian, rat swarm, and wolf/ dog stat blocks. There is also a special infected lasher zombie template (zombies that whip and entangle their prey using their own intestines), infected blob zombie template (zombies that spew bile and rotting flesh to attract other zombies), and infected stalker zombie template (zombies that leap large distances to pounce upon their prey), each with a zombie civilian example.

There is also the intelligent infected zombie template for portraying characters who are overcome by the zombie infection but retain their intelligence, along with an infected intelligent super-hero zombie example.

Rounding out this product are eight plot ideas for using infected zombies in your game, and suggestions on how the zombie infection may function in your game.

169613.name: Creature Feature: Slime Dragon
169613.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creature Feature Slime Dragon brings Acidic Fun to Your Savage Worlds Game

Each Creature Feature presents acid-covered predator that stalks sewers and other places of refuse. Their touch can dissolve weapons, equipment, and armor; and they can spew forth corrosive slime.

Creature Feature Slime Dragon presents a monstrous creature that burrows through the earth in search of food. These immense, subterranean hunters can even burrow through stone walls, allowing it to hunt its prey by vibration just about anywhere it may hide.

169614.name: Creature Feature: Doom Worm
169614.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creature Feature Doom Worm Digs Out the Fun in Your Savage Worlds Game

Each Creature Feature release details a single creature. Some will be general enough for most any setting or genre, while others are clearly intended for something specific, such as a fantasy genre game.

Creature Feature Doom Worm presents a monstrous creature that burrows through the earth in search of food. These immense, subterranean hunters can even burrow through stone walls, allowing it to hunt its prey by vibration just about anywhere it may hide.

169615.name: Dungeons 1
169615.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pack contains various maps from AdventureAWeek.com and is suitable for use in your favorite virtual tabletop!

169625.description:
The 20th investigation for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.
In 1887, you're going to investigate across London about the mysterious Man without Face.
Will you solve the mystery?
169625.name: Sherlock Holmes Détective Conseil: L'Homme Sans Visage

2511.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: The Thames Murders & Other Cases

169626.name: Spider Temple & Tower
169626.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pack contains various maps from AdventureAWeek.com and is suitable for use in your favorite virtual tabletop!

169627.name: Streets & Sewers 1
169627.description:

169631.name: Wilderness Overland 1 & 2
169631.description:
From publisher blurb:

This pack contains various maps from AdventureAWeek.com and is suitable for use in your favorite virtual tabletop!

169632.name: The Doctor and the Dalek
169632.description:
User Summary

The Doctor and the Dalek is a videogame developed and published by BBC. In the game featuring Peter Capaldi as the doctor he stumbles upon a Dalek that has been captured by Cybermen. He saves the Dalek but it turns out that it has been heavily damaged. As the doctors companion it's up to you to help it being repaired.

The player needs to solve puzzles and repair the dalek to full strenght. The game also is educational as it helps students to get the core programming principles as they play through the game.

169633.name: Attack of the Graske
169633.description:
"Attack of the Graske" is an interactive mini-episode of the British science fiction television series Doctor Who that was first broadcast on the BBC Red Button service on 25 December 2005. It is now available as an online game on the official Doctor Who website.

The human race is in danger of being replaced by alien changelings. Only the Doctor's new companion (the viewer) can stop them.

Source: Wikipedia, "Attack of the Graske", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

169634.name: Panic: War of the Khan Succession
169634.description:
In fighting off the Western Xia, Genghis Khan died a sudden illness. The golden head of the family had not time to establish a successor to the empire. Now each surviving prince ranked himself heir to the empire. When word of the Khan's death spread throughout Eurasia, the princes went to war to establish their worthiness.

Play Introduction:
1. Place the map on the center of the table.
2. Separate the 4 different region cards and shuffle the each stack, then place each stack on the corresponding position on the map.
3. Mix troops in their draw bag.
4. Prepare an discard area.
5. Each player takes a corresponding color screen and 10 tokens, and then randomly takes six troops card from the bag, and places behind their screen as the starting Standby Force

The game takes place over several battles. The first player to win a battle to earns the first player token (the Scarecrow).
In order, the players choose cards from the four regions where the battle will take place. Each battle takes place in player sequence, and takes place in 3 stages. After the 3rd stage of the battle is complete, a new region card is turned over, and play continues until a victor is declared.

Victory conditions:
In a 4-player game, if a player occupies 3 areas the game is over immediately, and the player wins the game; in a 2-3 player game, if a player occupies the four areas the game is over immediately, the player wins the game

169635.description:
This is a single promo card for the Unspeakable Words board game given out at conventions and game days.

It can be used in place of any other letter and is worth a number of points equal to your number of Cthulhu Pawns.
169635.name: Unspeakable Words: "Unspeakable Letter" Promo Card

169636.name: Exalted of Kalos
169636.description:
Save Kalos. Work as a team - but look out for yourself.

These are the concerns in Exalted of Kalos. Monsters pour from the wilderness, trying to overrun the land. Your group, the mightiest heroes in Kalos, must stop this invasion. After the invaders (and at least one deadly "boss") are routed, only one of your number will be granted the title "Exalted of Kalos".

Exalted of Kalos finds the sweet-spot in between several gaming styles. It is easy to learn, even for beginners. At the same time, experience and tactics play a vital role. EoK plays much like a "board collapser" cooperative game - where the players work together against automated challenges. However, it also gives each individual their own agenda.

Players each take control of a character with their own strengths and weaknesses. Players must manage power and timing to make the most of their turns. This is crucial, not only in surviving as a group, but in making themselves stand out individually.

169637.name: Bang the Button!!!
169637.description:
Bang the Button!!! is an educational and interactive game that has been developed for learners of English as a foreign language for beginner levels. (Starters, A1 and A2, according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR)).

It is a unique, very complete game that can (and should) be used as a complement to any method (digital or more traditional) that is used in the classroom. Playing the game at home is of course also great fun!

Especially the oral skills (speaking and listening) are trained in this game that is played in small groups (3 – 6 players). The game allows a lot of interaction between the players, exactly what we want in foreign language teaching.
The game is also very useful for getting rid of the usual shyness that many learners feel. The game is very challenging and educational.

The game Bang the Button is, as mentioned above, very complete and includes a variety of aspects, such as:

vocabulary
grammar
communication
culture
movement
interaction
constant participation of all players
a healthy dose of competion

169638.name: Recycling Center
169638.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 229th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small community recycling center.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4320x4032 pixels in size at 144dpi.

169639.description:
The 2014 Asmodee promo card set is a set of two cards that can be added to any Dixit game simply by shuffling them into the deck before the game. These cards are:


"Pumpkinhead"
"Santa"
169639.name: Dixit: "Pumpkinhead" and "Santa" promo cards

169640.name: Amy's History Hunt
169640.description:
As the Doctor has disappeared and taken his sonic screwdriver with him, you'll need to enter a sequence of digits in order to crack the code that opens the safe. All you have to do is answer questions about places the TARDIS has visited and friends of the Doctor. If you get all three questions right about a single person or place you release a digit and move a step further to opening the safe. But Amy explains all this in the video!

Watch her message and then click on 'Start the History Hunt' to begin the adventure! Initially you'll get a choice of people and places you can investigate. After selecting one of them you should click on the 'Find out more about...' icon. You'll be whisked away to another page where you can either plunge straight into the questions by clicking on 'Unlock a piece of the code' or find out more about the person by following links to websites and exclusive videos. All the answers to the questions can be found in there somewhere!

By correctly answering three questions you'll release a digit that automatically registers on the safe's read out. When you've cracked the code you'll have opened the Doctor's safe and find his favourite painting. And as a sign of the Doctor gratitude for your help you'll get an exclusive short story that fills you in in on what he's been up to whilst you've been helping Amy!

Source: The Publisher Website.

169641.name: Black Hole
169641.description:
User Summary

In this game you must pilot the TARDIS though asteroids and other obstacles. You will jump your TARDIS from one position to another and get as high as possible. The higher the more points.

169642.description:
The DC Comics DBG Crossover series truly "crosses over" with the first ever appearance of characters from the hit DC Comics/CW TV Series Arrow in DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Crossover Pack 2 – Arrow, which includes Arrow, Diggle, Felicity and many more.

Crossover Packs are the perfect way for players to customize their DC Comics experience to suit their own tastes and to play with their favorite characters! Grab your favorite DC set and instead of using the Super Heroes and Super-Villains from that set, use the ones from this pack instead! To further immerse you in the world of Arrow, you will find plenty of Equipment, Super Power, Hero, Villain, and Location cards from the show in the main deck.
169642.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Crossover Pack 2 – Arrow

169643.name: Dalek versus Cybermen
169643.description:
User Summary

At the battle of Canary Wharf Torchwood set free a group of Daleks and Cybermen onto the world. Luckily the doctor intervened and saved the world (yet again). In Daleks vs Cybermen however as a player you take control of a squad of Cybermen and try to turn the battle in the favor of the Cybermen. Fight your way past UNIT troops, The preachers and Daleks!

169644.name: Death Skid Marks
169644.description:
Death Skid Marks is a trashy hard as hell car combat game about a post-apocalyptic road trip to the ultimate gig.

Drive 666 KMs to the ultimate concert.
Unique blend of top-down arcade action, RPGs and rogue-likes
Trashy humor and art.
Original metal/rock/punk soundtrack.
Battle charming people in crappy cars such as inbreds and intolerant fanatics.
Arm yourself with high tech weaponry such as pistols, bricks and chainsaws.
A full run that lasts around 1H30, replay often but die often.
Completely random levels, infinite replay value.
30 achievements that all unlock new content.
32 vehicles to drive.
Over 70 different items to buy.
Choose how you earn money with tasks.
Gambling mini-games.
16 hitchhikers.
11 bosses and around 50 different enemy types (not counting variations).
Meet friendly but misunderstood bosses who will probably kill you often. To make this even better, there are more bosses than room for them in each runs, so you won't be able to predict what charming friend awaits.
Upgrade your ride to outdrive your foes and get wasted on drugs to upgrade your stats!
Four different endings.
Total lack of zombies and chiptune sound samples!
You will die often.

Source: The Game Website.

169645.name: Scepter
169645.description:
Think of it as Magic: the Gathering meets Monopoly.

You and your party protect you homeland, and win your opponent's scepter. This is a game of battling special abilities to obtain land, pour magic into your land with magic stones.

You will build decks of creature, item and spell cards. You begin the game by building a deck of about 20 cards. Player tokens begin on zero, as well as the starting castle, on the board. Each player starts with 7 cards from the starter deck. You can do each of the following once per turn:

1. Take 2 cards from your deck, keep one, place the 2nd on the bottom of the draw deck.
2. Use 1 spell card.
3. Roll the dice to move your token on the board.
4. Perform and action, such as summoning creatures (up to their required land value).
5. Pay the toll to another player if you land on their space.
6. Discard down to 7 cards.

Just remember Draw, Roll, Play a card. When you land on an empty space, you will fill it with one of your creature cards. When you land on a space already occupied by an opponent, you pay a toll or play a creature to battle it. Prior to battle, player can equip their creatures with items.

The goal is to obtain the most land.

169646.name: Jumpgate Armada
169646.description:
Jumpgate Armada is a sci-fi themed action packed 2-4 player board game, where you control one of two federation called Alpha or Omega. Take control of your federation ships to perform assaults against your opponent while gathering a valuable resource called type 12 ore, collected by each player's mining ships.

Each player also plays jumpgate cards, where dangerous events can take place. Experience ships being pulled inside black holes, unknown parasites liquefying and absorbing a player's ship or evaporated by the mysteries monoliths. Don't blink your eyes or you will be struck by asteroids, comets and meteorites then destroyed!

Smile at your opponent by obtaining tracker beams, shield restorers, bonus attack modifiers and experience the power of a super nova penetrating every ship in play and disabling their shields to 50 % or destroying them!

Jumpgate Armada is full of excitement, twists, and turns. Offering memorable laughs with your friends and family. Where Anything can happen. So climb aboard, buckle up, and brace yourself for the many adventures Jumpgate Armada will take you to!

169647.description: The Human Ranger Talon Everhale is one of five blind boosters that players may purchase as an entrance fee to participate in Months 2-6 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The booster includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
169647.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Human Ranger Expansion Pack

169648.description: The Wood Elf Druid Dragonfly the Grey is one of five blind boosters that players may purchase as an entrance fee to participate in Months 2-6 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The booster includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
169648.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Wood Elf Druid Expansion Pack

169649.description:
The time has come for the tribe to leave its shelter and head for new lands. As the chief of your clan, it's up to you to guide your prehistoric people through the valley: Take advantage of the environment, pick and hunt for food, discover big and safe caverns for the upcoming winter, gather your tribe and discover the valley!

Sapiens is a short and easy-to-learn tile-placement game that can prove much deeper than it seems for gamers. Each player has a personal game board that represents the valley on which they will play tiles to determine the journey of their tribe through several prehistoric life scenes. Their aim is to gather food points on the plains and in the forests of the valley and to get shelter points for reaching caves in the mountains. A player's turn consists of two steps:


Connect one new tile from the four in his personal pool to the tiles already in play on his board, with connected scenes needing to match. These placements earn food points when a connection is made, earns shelter points when a cave is reached, and sometimes provides a special ability based on the connected scenes.
Choose a new tile from the five available in a common pool to re-fill his personal pool to four tiles.


Sapiens relies on instinctive domino-like mechanisms that are improved by interesting twists:


Laying tiles on personal (modular) game boards brings a bit of a puzzle feel to the game.
Having two separate scores — food and shelter — and knowing that only their lower one matters when determining who wins confronts players with interesting needs and dilemmas.
Including special powers linked to the eight different scenes represented on the tiles brings a lot of interaction and choices.
169649.name: Sapiens

169650.description:
This was a KS Exclusive figure for Rivet Wars. Rosie has a special action that allows field repairs of units.

Contents:

Rosie the Riveter figure
Rosie plug figure
2 cards
169650.name: Rivet Wars: Rosie the Riveter

169651.name: Kaputt!
169651.description:
Kaputt is a strategy wargame -sort of 'postmodern soccerchess'– with the essencial difference that the board itself is always changing, giving a completely different experience each time you play this hilarious and surprising battle.

Configure your soldiers. Attack and/or move with them and carry the time-bomb to the enemy's headquarters. Do it carefully, so the opponent can't stole it from you and make your strategy a nightmare!

Walk on a battlefield composed by 133 mixed pieces full of surprises: mines, tunnels (they transport you to other tunnels!), ruins, barricades and incognito fields. Ruins and incognito fields which make you draw the most bizarre cards you've ever heard of.

Winning will be the most hilarious experience with «Kaputt».

169652.description:
THUNDER TRACK takes careful planning, patience, wit, and a healthy dose of foresight to become a champion. Get too far ahead and you'll become everyone's target. Fall too far back and you might not be able to catch up by the end of the race. Waste all your RPMs and Ammo and you may not have them when you need them most. With plenty of surprises around every corner, only the driver who knows how to react quickly—and carefully—will head home with a trophy.

Building on the platform established by Turbo Rally Card Racing, THUNDER TRACK introduces a whole new level of strategy into the mix! Using your own 1:64 scale die-cast cars, race opponents along rally themed card tracks that you create. The cards are expandable so you can challenge unlimited players and build courses as simple or as big as you can imagine.

On your turn, flip one track card over, and follow the signs as you race through jumps and obstacles toward the finish line—all while fending off attacks from your opponents. The first player to reach the winner's circle wins one of five trophies—and an advantage in the next race!

But don't think for a second that getting to the Winner's Circle is easy. With over 30 RPM (Radical Performance Maneuvers) cards that allow players to boost ahead, burst through obstacles or sabotage opponents, THUNDER TRACK shifts racing strategy into high gear. Whether it's smokescreens and straightaways or pit stops and pace notes, the right RPM combo at the right time will keep your foot on the gas and your opponents off-track.

If tire spikes and land mines can’t seem to keep your fellow racers from taking the top spot in the winner’s circle, don’t worry, we’re also introducing 10 different weapons to choose from. Send your opponents skidding off track with a missile attack or drag them into the dirt and leave them stranded with a well-aimed grappling hook. But, whichever weapon you choose, you’ll have access to unique special abilities and features sure to keep your opponents eating your dust.

Think you've got what it takes to be a Turbo Rally Card Racing Champion? Only the toughest will survive the new THUNDER TRACK...
169652.name: Turbo Rally Card Racing: Thunder Track

169653.description:
Set in 8th century Northern Britain, Before Scotland: 750 AD - Empires is an epic economy-based tactical-combat strategy game. It is historical in nature with a rich context and set of mechanics drawn from original sources.

The game begins in 750 AD and lets you play as one of four kingdoms who struggle for supremacy: the Angles, Britons, Gaels, or Picts. After choosing a Leader and Moral Cause that give special abilities to your kingdom, each player works through four seasons each year: planning, deployment, battle, and recovery. During planning season, you collect tax revenues, recruit troops, and identify battle targets. During deployment season, you muster Warbands, travel the environment, and scout the terrain. During battle season, you engage opponents in battle and resolve individual skirmishes. During recovery season, you pay maintenance, retreat units and reinforce adjacent territories.

Actions in each phase affect the outcome of the next phase. For example, by travelling the Environment and scouting the Terrain during deployment season; you will alter the engagements in battle season. The battle system requires each player to select up to 3 Warband Unit cards, from their hand, that face-off with competing kingdoms. After a simultaneous reveal, cards are resolved one-versus-one with additional Supply, Tactics, or Training cards from the Warband, and purchased during planning season, that are used to modify the encounter. Winning cards remain at the settlement. Losing cards are returned to the Kingdom Reserve and must be re-purchased to re-enter the game. The game ends after 5 (shorter), or 10 (longer), years of in-game play and the remaining player with the highest net-worth wins.

This game is targeted at the serious strategy gamer and it is an in-depth title that combines deck-building, a working economy and geographic constraints.
169653.name: Before Scotland: 750 AD – Empires

169654.description:
From the rulebook:

A group of poor explorers hoping to get rich quickly heads out to recover treasures from some undersea ruins. They're all rivals, but their budgets force them all to share a single rented submarine. In the rented submarine, they all have to share a single tank of air, as well. If they don't get back to the sub before they run out of air, they'll drop all their treasure. Now it's time to see who can bring home the greatest riches.

Game Objective
The game takes place over 3 rounds, and the player to gain the most points over the 3 rounds is the winner. In order to gain points, you must bring the most ruins chips back to the submarine. You can only return to the submarine once per round, and you cannot progress more after returning. You cannot return to the submarine without bringing any ruins chips.

Turn Progression
On their turns, players conduct steps 1-4 listed below. Players take turns, going clockwise around the board, and the round ends when all players have returned to the submarine, or if the air runs out at the beginning of someone's turn.

1) Declare if you will turn back or not.
2) Reduce air.
3) Roll the dice and advance your game piece.
4) Search. (When you have stopped moving, select one of A-C below)
A) Do nothing.
B) Pick up ruins chip.
C) Place a ruins chip.
169654.name: Deep Sea Adventure

169655.name: Higamus Hogamus
169655.description:
Higamus Hogamus is a card game where the players must match pairs of cards that combine to make compound words. Each player is dealt six cards. On their turn, they may either draw a card from the draw pile or take a card from another player's hand. They then look in their hand for any pairs that make words (such as "cow" and "boy") and lay them down. There are also "Higamus" and "Hogamus" cards depicting the titular pigs that are worth bonus points but must be announced when drawn (so other players can draw from their hands to try to steal the points) and Krazy Kat and Holy Cow cards that deduct points.

A round ends when either any player runs out of cards or a player holds both Higamus and Hogamus in his or her hand. Players score one point for each card they have laid down, five points each for Higamus or Hogamus and negative five points each for Holy Cow and Krazy Kat.

An alternate version of the game allows players to ask other players for specific cards and play either cards that form compound words or matching cards. In this version, Krazy Kat and Holy Cow are a match as are Higamus and Hogamus.

169656.name: The Creditor's Deal
169656.description:
The Creditor's Deal is a card game created by the Frandzel & Share law firm as a gift for their clients. The theme is building a portfolio of loans.

Each player is dealt seven cards, and the rest of the cards go into a draw pile. On their turns, players check their hands for completed loans (a loan card and matching collateral card, or these two plus a guaranty card for higher-value loans) and then lay the cards down face-down in their portfolio. They then either draw a card from the draw pile or take the top card from the face-up discard pile. If they have more than seven cards, they must now discard down to seven.

Other cards can help complete loans, take away money, steal card from other players, steal or protect completed loans or cause another player's loan to be auctioned.

The game ends when the draw pile is gone. Players add the value of all their completed loans and subtract regulatory or legal fee cards and any unplayed completed loans they hold. The player with the highest total wins.

169657.name: Hooked on Spelling Card Game
169657.description:
From the box:
"Practice spelling skills by creating words with Beginning and Ending game cards. The first player to play all ten cards wins."

Players are dealt ten cards each. Each card has either a beginning or ending of a word--generally 1-3 letters. The dealer turns over the top card of the draw deck. The first player must then make a word by adding either a beginning or end card, as appropriate. The next player may then either cover the beginning or ending of the played word with one of their own cards to make a new word. If a player is unable to play a card, he or she passes to the next player. If no player can make a new word, another card is drawn from the draw pile to replace the beginning or ending card and play resumes.

The first player to use all his or her card wins.

169658.description:
It's spring break in Arthursburg, a time when kids set out on heroic quests of excitement and imagination. But this year, the danger and magic are real - the residents and wildlife around town have been transformed into evil monsters bent on total destruction!

Only you and your friends have the power and wits to rise up and save your loved ones from this unknown evil.

To defeat the monstrous hordes that are spreading chaos and evil everywhere they go.

To become the legendary heroes who will save the people of Arthursburg.

THE GUARDIANS!

The Guardians: Explore is a card drafting, deck refinement adventure game for 2-5 players, running eight total turns, and games lasting approximately 45-90 minutes long. It's broken down into two chapters; Warm Up and Battle.

Players begin their Warm Up with a card draft that shapes their strategy for the battle to come. A unique super card is selected in secret to give each player their own special strength and two unique missions provide optional goals.

Now fortified with equipment, skills, and familiars, the players begin the Battle! By drawing and cleverly playing cards from the top of their deck, players build the power needed to defeat monsters and acquire trophies with each turn.

During play, unneeded cards can be thrown away and powerful locations can be fortified with blanket forts to prepare player's for the final showdown. Work together to defeat the mighty boss at the heart of the monster invasion and save Arthursburg!
169658.name: The Guardians: Explore

169659.name: Another Star
169659.description:
Another Star is a console-style RPG with a fast-paced battle system and a world that encourages players to explore and discover hidden areas as they lead their party on a journey across a fantasy world. While clearly influenced by the style and gameplay of the past, the game also implements innovations and ideas from the present.

Inspired by the 26th Ludum Dare competition theme of Minimalism, Another Star uses but a single 128×128 tile sheet to bring you a vast world to explore. Secrets are hidden everywhere, and you never know what you might find on the next screen. Those who take the time to explore instead of merely rushing to the next objective will certainly be rewarded.

Battles are turn based, but play out quickly. There's no need for complicated targeting here, simply choose to attack and everyone in your party will deal damage to every enemy. But be careful! Enemies will do the same to you, making them even more dangerous in numbers. Your HP will drain quickly, so be sure to use abilities and items to your advantage. Those who only choose to fight are apt to meet an early demise.

Don't feel like fighting random battles? You'd rather explore awhile and then grind a little later? No problem! Random encounters are only initiated by accepting them when the yellow "!" icon appears over your head. Just watch out for sneak attacks. If you see the red "!!" icon appear, you better press the button quickly to accept or else you'll be taken by surprise.

Our story begins with Tachi, the prince of Clan Minas. Sent by his father to retrieve a falling star that promises to upset the balance of the clans, the young warrior gets caught up in a sudden chain of events that will affect the entire planet. The fledgling warrior will journey across entire continents, slowly unraveling the mysteries of the world around him and encountering countless new people and places.

While some retro games focus on parody and humor, Another Star lets its plot play out on its own weight to evoke the atmosphere of storytelling in an age when storage space was tight even for simple text and every word had to count.

Tachi's adventure is presented using a high-quality CRT shader to emulate the feel of the old 8-bit consoles that inspired its look. Don't like the effect? System too slow to handle it? You can toggle the shader on and off at any time with the simple push of a button.

The game also features a full, original soundtrack composed in the style of a YM2413 FM synth chip. The budget-priced chip was a common add-on for consoles and computers of the late 8-bit era, and its unique FM tone should make retro game lovers feel right at home.

Source: The Publisher Website.

169660.name: Accidental Runner
169660.description:
User Summary

Accidental Runner is an arcade action game where you will play a business man cursed to run forever, in the desert. The curse also includes the business man to run without forward movement, so he has to dodge all sorts of hazards.

169661.name: Cubot
169661.description:
the First Contact

At first sight, Cubot is a 3D puzzle-game with a minimalist gameplay, just move color cubes towards tiles of the same color. It's really ease, but an important point in the gameplay is if you have multiple cubes, they move simultaneously! It will be a torture for your mind to complete all levels.

an Easy Gameplay

One finger is enough to move the cube where you want...that's it!

Simplistic but not Repetitive

Several concepts are used to diversify puzzles but also to make them more complex. Like color cubes with different capacities or elements (buttons, elevators, color swappers, teleporters…)

Clean and Pure

The game and menus have a clean look to not disturb your concentration. In the same vein, the music is very soothing.

Several Hours of Play

There are 80 levels in the game for several hours of playtime to keep you challenged.

Challenging but Possible

The challenge increases level by level. If you are stumped, help is available!

Source: The Publisher Website.

169662.name: Irregular Zone
169662.description:
User Summary

Irregular Zone is a game that contains both text adventure and RTS elements. The story is about a girl who becomes the singularity in another world which she is destined to save. You will have new teammates along the way.

169663.name: Koala Kids
169663.description:
User Summary

Koala Kids is a puzzle & platformer game, where you play as a Koala. The Koala needs to save its captured friends, but will find many obstacles in the way!

169664.name: The Interview
169664.description:
User Summary

You are playing as Adam, who is unemployed. Adam wanted a job, so he has been searching for one. Today it is his job interview. He is curious about it, but he is even more curious about the red little box at the end of the hallway.

169665.name: Cold Contract
169665.description:
Cold Contract offers you to lead mercenaries in an hostile region. You plan your assault, equip/improve the guys, and move in real-time to your objective on the strategic map. You fight enemy squads during turn-based action. Most parts of the game are generated with an algorithm, which ensure that each game and fight will never be the same than the last.

Build your team

Take the lead of mercenaries deployed in an hostile region. Choose who will join your team. Equip them with the best equipment for the task. Extend their skills with experience and special abilities. Engage enemy squads in several environment and situations

War is random

Each game is generated from scratch with an algorithm. You will never find the same region or location. Position of enemies, buildings, objectives are always different. High level of re- playability. Test your sense of strategy and your sense of tactic. And maybe a bit of luck

The rules of engagement are changing

Access to eight tasks of missions. Rescue hostages. Find weapons. Grab money. Destroy military equipment. Eliminate special enemies. Fight against squadrons of elite soldiers. Experience is the key of deadlier mercenaries.

Improve your power

Upgrade your base camp to unlock new options. Gain more firepower and extend the size of your squads. Access to satellite and tactical drone. Locate and spy enemies. Protect your base from airborne assault. Use psychological warfare to rise civilians against enemies. Heal your mercenaries with field hospital.

Source: The Game Website.

169666.name: Downpour
169666.description:
Help Jasmine the butterfly move around the raindrops to reach her home! Collect flowers for bonuses, boosts, and secret abilities.

Source: The Publisher Website.

169667.name: Synonymy
169667.description:
How can you go from a word like 'morbid' to a word like 'ecstatic'? Or from 'fastidious' to 'vigil'?

Synonymy is a game of finding the paths between random words through their network of synonyms. By taking the synonym of a word, and then a synonym of that synonym, and so on, you can ultimately arrive at any other word in the English language. (Spanish, French, German and Japanese in the works!)

Swipe or press w,s,a,d on a keyboard to navigate through multiple pages of synonyms and to navigate through the menus of the game. On the bottom of the gameplay view, you will see the goal word beside markers that highlight what page you're currently on.

Source: The Game Website.

169668.description:
A special die with two "C" wildcard faces and a 2, 3, 4 and 5 will replace the white die in the center of your Cubo.

If your yellow die shows the wildcard "C", you can choose any number from 1 to 6.
169668.name: Cubo Queenie 1: Special Dice

169669.description:
6 Task Tiles out of 12 will be drawn at the beginning of a game. 1 will be flipped over at the beginning of each round.

At the end of the round, after each player scored his "Cubo", every Cubo is checked again to see if a player has met the task. If so he will score the extra points depicted on the tile.
169669.name: Cubo Queenie 2: Combinations

169670.description:
4 extra rules to let you score even in diagonal!

If you ever played Cubo with the base rules, it is time to spice it a bit more letting even the dice in the diagonals. So your Cubo will score 8 times instead of 6!
169670.name: Cubo Queenie 3: Diagonals

169671.description:
Speedball gives you additional copies of the most popular Weapons and Equipment found in the 1st Wave games.
It also gives you dozens of new Weapon and Equipment cards, as well as more Missions and Objectives.
169671.name: Warfighter Expansion #5: Speedball

149951.name: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

169672.description:
United Kingdom gives you Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from the United Kingdom. Also included are their Weapon and Equipment cards.

This provides you with everything you need to run missions.
All you need to do is use these Soldier, Weapon, and Equipment cards instead of the US cards at the start of a Mission, and you are good to go!

Also includes more Mission and Objective cards!
169672.name: Warfighter Expansion #6: United Kingdom

149951.name: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

169673.description:
Russian Federation gives you Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from the Russian Federation.

Also included are their Weapon and Equipment cards.

This provides you with everything you need to run missions: All you need to do is use these Soldier, Weapon, and Equipment cards instead of the US cards at the start of a Mission, and you are good to go! Also includes more Mission and Objective cards!
169673.name: Warfighter Expansion #7: Russian Federation

149951.name: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

169674.description:
Eastern European Adversaries adds the Eastern European Region to the game.
This Expansion gives you Hostile cards, Event cards, and Location cards for the Eastern European Region.

This is everything you need to take the war to a whole new enemy with your US, UK, and Russian teams! Also includes more Mission and Objective cards!
169674.name: Warfighter Expansion #8: Eastern European Adversaries

149951.name: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game

169675.description:
French version of Cards Against Humanity

L'osti d'jeu is here!

How to play the game?

1. The big mouth (grande yeule) plays a black card. For example: Steak, Corn, | ... |
2. All other players choose a red card in their hand that much fill the | ... |
3. The big mouth (grande yeule) then chooses his favorite red card ...
For example, which would you choose between:
> Steak, Corn, A big keel Wildcat
> Steak, Corn, Your mother
> Steak, Corn, A big watery diarrhea
... The player who played that red card wins the black card.
4. Play until satisfied, or until a player has won 5 black cards.

The game is only available in French and is full of insides about the Quebec French culture.
169675.name: L'osti d'jeu

169676.name: Abomination Tower
169676.description:
Abomination Tower is a humorously macabre, 2D procedurally generated platformer. The game is set in a tower where the rejected creations of a mad scientist are left to die. You play Headless, one such creation, trying to escape the tower and find freedom.

Headless is in a unique situation that allows him to equip different heads that are unlocked as you progress through the game. Each head has it’s own identity and with each identity comes a unique ability. Collect eyeballs and finish the level to unlock heads.

Controls

Abomination Tower is best played with a gamepad controller but a keyboard can be used. Use the spacebar to jump and the directional keys to move if using a keyboard.

Source: The Publisher Website.

169677.name: Final Dusk
169677.description:
Amazing adventure

Mina the Vampire princess needs your help! Evil witch turned all her brethren to stone. Your goal is to protect and assist the young princess in her quest to reverse the spell. Travel through the kingdom of Vempire and conquer your foes on your way to evil witch's tower. Test your wits and dexterity overcoming various environmental obstacles.

Enticing story

Learn the story of a young, inexperienced vampire princess who, facing a terrible crisis, must take the fate of an entire kingdom of Vempire in her own hands. Meet her family and friends as well as terrifying enemies she has to face. Discover the baffling truth behind the spell that sparked all the unrest.

Rich and unique world

Visit four completely unique parts of the kingdom filled with various enemies as you try to reach your goal. Find collectibles, defeat bosses, unlock new chapters of the grand adventure.

Acquire new powers

Complete each chapter to unlock new abilities! Turn into a bat or cast illusion to distract enemies. Every power has two modes which can be used differently depending on the environment. Use them wisely and remember that Mina is counting on you.

Source: The Developer Website.

169678.name: Real Horror Stories
169678.description:
If you found a bridge to the other side, would you cross it? Would you enter the realm of the dead, where tormented souls live in eternal darkness?

The gates of death cannot remain shut for very much longer. They will forever open on the night of the full moon. During mother-earth's most fertile season, the harvester will reap the lost souls of the sinful. soon, new crops will come to life from her pregnant soils.

"I'll send you back to her soil, to quench the earth's thirst for blood."

Source: The Publisher Website.

169679.name: Paranormal
169679.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Uncover the mystery through journal entries. No haunting is ever the same thanks to the complex action-reaction and randomization system in the game. The game has first-person camera, much like in Paranormal Activity or Blair Witch Project. You will be taking a role of an artist who has a haunted house and decides to start filming the hauntings.

The game has been developed and published by Matthew C Cohen.

169680.name: Bloodforge
169680.description:
From publisher blurb:

If half-elves and half-orcs exist, what if other races could mix? What strange and mysterious crossbreeds would populate a world where you can merge creatures, and races, with magic? Explore all of these potentials, where creatures born from magic and strange unions are unveiled. Expand your potential with any of these unique hybrid races. Compatible with Pathfinder RPG, any game could use this book, which gives massive amounts of options both for players and Gamemasters to expand their world with.

Bloodforge is a 110 page book that includes:

30 different half-breed races that are playable from the start. From the hybrid Lasher, to the halfblood Grendle, there are combinations and races for almost any concept.
Alternate racial traits and new favored class options for all of the 30 new races presented in this book!
New templates for creating monsters (and perhaps players) who straddle the really monstrous, from half-medusas to half-titans. Included are also different sample half-breed monsters to spice up your next adventure with!
Tons of new feats, including Heritage feats that allow you to explore your character's mixed blood!
New prestige classes that explore the strange mixing of blood and flesh and what they mean.
New spells tied to the blood that courses through the veins of these strange hybrids.
New weapon enhancements & wondrous items that give you new options!
Suggestions and tips on how to mutate, hybridize and change other creatures!

169681.name: Monster Keepers
169681.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Keepers is a light-hearted Meta game meant to compliment any role-playing game system. This game encourages both meta-gaming AND micromanagement from the players.

You should already be proficient with or at least possess a passing familiarity with role-playing games in order to use this product. Therefore you should already know what you need for this game but just to be sure you will need dice, cards, miniatures (or some other way of representing where things are), dungeons, and imagination.

This game is not a stand-alone product. You will need any of the countless varieties of fantasy role-playing game systems out there. This game does not provide statistics or rules for running the player characters or monsters. This game provides a foundation for running the dungeon and random charts for what happens during the course of managing the dungeon.

169682.name: Open Spaces: In the Fields...
169682.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have your PCs ever entered a broad landscape where you didn't have anything planned? So you pulled out a random encounter table, rolled, and *blam* - combat! What if you had another tool in your arsenal to use in these situations?

Open Spaces products aim to answer that question or at least offer some guidance as you enter those wild, uncharted areas with your PCs. The next time the party chooses to go gallavanting across the world, you can use these supplements to suggest new encounters both for good and ill.

In this case, Open Spaces: Fields can be used when your party traipses across some farmer’s fields or some Lord’s demesne. You might let it go... or perhaps they'll run into:

Bandits
A strange creature
Or just a group of farmers talking about how horrific the weather has been




Like the Little Spaces series, Open Spaces offers a collection of tables along with some examples and a worksheet to help inspire you quickly. So pull out a few dice and see what's waiting in the fields for your PCs!

169683.name: The Experiment Continues
169683.description:
From publisher blurb:

This companion volume to the EPOCH roleplaying game presents you with new rules, advice and options to support and enhance your games. Included are:

A survival guide to improve your character’s chances of reaching the end scenes.
A toolkit with advice and techniques to assist GM’s with scenario facilitation.
A guide for designing scenarios, covering everything from structuring tension phases to creating a horror track.
Two new card decks with optional rules to twist character stories and randomly resolve outcomes.




The Experiment Continues also includes four new scenarios:

Make your farewells and prepare to embark on an epic journey in the classical age of heroes when you are selected as one of THE TRIBUTE.
Join a crew of streetwise gangsters bootlegging liquor during the prohibition in DEATH ON THE STREETS.
It’s coming for you, it doesn’t tire and it won’t stop - your only hope is to confront what lurks deep within the SLAUGHTERHOUSE.
Visit the picturesque seaside town of Hudson’s Point and experience an autumn festival like no other in HARVEST.




EPOCH is a game of character-driven survival horror. The goal is to deliver a tense and scary experience in a single game session. EPOCH players are active participants in the creation of the game atmosphere and have complete control over the creation and ultimate fate of their characters.

169684.name: One-Page Worlds: Monarch Tombs
169684.description:
From publisher blurb:

One-Page Worlds is a series of flavorful, thematic, and original game world ideas, distilled down to one page. The perfect place for budding gamemasters and aspiring designers to draw inspiration.

The Monarch Tombs is a world of lost greatness, of incredible wealth and those who call themselves kings and queens who clutch onto their heirlooms, artifacts, and mementos with ragged fists.

169685.name: Star Wars REUP (Revised, Expanded, Updated)
169685.description:
From Introduction:

Star Wars: Revised, Expanded and Updated (that is this version you are currently reading) is essentially a reorganization of the popular Star Wars: Second Edition Revised and Expanded rules, which in and of itself was an expansion of the Star Wars: Second Edition rules. The goal is to make the game just as easy to learn, but to update to content to account for all of the additions in both the Canon and Expanded Star Wars Universe since the last publication... way back in 1997. Only a few rules changes were included to continue following the track of the D6 system evolution.

Please note that very, very few actual changes are included in this rulebook. There are mostly “optional” rules additions. These are imported from many other D6 publications, including but not limited to The D6 Toolkit, D6 Space, D6 Fantasy, D6 Adventure, D6 Space Opera, and various other West End Games Star Wars supplements.


What’s New?

Star Wars: Revised, Expanded, and Updated features the following:

Extensive examples and explanations to make learning and understanding the rules easier;
A solitaire adventure “Cantina Breakout,” to let you start playing right away;
An index to this volume;
Expanded Combat Options and Force powers combining information from various supplements.
Expanded Adventuring information, combining all the gems from the original Gamemaster’s Handbook;
The beginning adventure “The Pirates of Prexiar”;
Aliens, vehicles, starships, and creatures from the Prequel, The Clone Wars, and the recent “Legends”
Expanded Universe;
Numerous character templates.




Finally, Star Wars: Revised, Expanded, and Updated concentrates on roleplaying over rules. The game is faster, easier, and more fun... and more like the original Star Wars movies!

We hope you enjoy this new iteration of the rules. And above all, we how that this will keep the wonders of the Star Wars D6 system alive for generations to come.

169686.name: Top Mage
169686.description:
In Top Mage, players participate in a fantastic contest between apprentices magicians. To win, you have to be the first to produce their Magic Items and clean out his alchemical laboratory.

Gather the appropriate cards of Enchantment, Item and Elements to produce their magic item. If needed, use the Spells to help.

Top Mage is a fun card game that involves strategy and luck. For 2-5 players with an average of 15 minutes per game.


No jogo Top Mage os jogadores participam de um fantástico desafio entre magos aprendizes. Para vencer, você terá que ser o primeiro a produzir seus itens mágicos e deixar seu laboratório alquímico limpo de resíduos mágicos.

Junte as cartas apropriadas de Encantamento, Item e Elementos para produzir o seu Item Mágico. Se precisar, utilize os feitiços para ajudar.

Top Mage é um divertido jogo de cartas que envolve estratégia e sorte. Para 2 a 5 jogadores com tempo médio de 15 minutos por partida.

169687.name: Taksikuski
169687.description:
A Finnish board game classic from the 1980s in which the players take the role of taxi drivers in an imaginary town. The aim is to collect as much money as possible.

Players start from the taxi station of their choice. Everyone picks up a customer and an address from the yellow customer deck. The taxi fee is determined by counting the spaces between the destination and the current location of the taxi car. Now, all the players must reach their destinations on the map by throwing two 6-sided dice and moving according to them on the board. When a customer reaches his destination, the player must pick up a red destination card: Will the customer be able to pay after all? Or will he even tip you some extra? Or maybe rob you of half of your money?

After successfully completing a trip, the players return to a taxi station to pick up a new customer. Whoever has the most money after a predetermined time or other limit (e.g. end of deck) is declared the winner.

169688.name: Villainy: Turf War

boardgamecompilation.169757: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #13

169688.description:
Expansion for Villainy

After defeating the other villains, your team takes control of a key location in the city. This location gives your team some additional rewards.

169690.description: The Half-Black Dragon Fighter Rezmir is one of five blind boosters that players may purchase as an entrance fee to participate in Months 2-6 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The booster includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
169690.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Half-Black Dragon Fighter Expansion Pack

169691.description: The Human Red Wizard Rath Modar is one of five blind boosters that players may purchase as an entrance fee to participate in Months 2-6 of the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Tyranny of Dragons. The booster includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
169691.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Human Red Wizard Expansion Pack

169692.description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, given out by Abacus at Spiel 2014 in Essen.
This expansion consists of 1 tile with a kiwi.

Use the normal rules for Zooloretto, except for: the first player to fill his 6-space enclosure takes the enclosure with the kiwi as a bonus. If it is the owner's turn he can pay 1 coin to rearrange all tiles on the delivery trucks instead of taking an action (only once in the game).
Scoring: A coin on the kiwi enclosure is not considered during scoring.
169692.name: Zooloretto: Kiwi

169693.description:
A Fight or Flight game where you fight to survive, build an SOS sign and try to live till rescue. Be careful, night brings Cannibals.

Collect food, resources, weapons and tools while you fight (or flee) for your life in the Cooperative (or Solo) Survival Game.

In this epic survival game you play the role of a crash survivor who washed up on a beautiful island. Without food or water you need to collect food, build tools, craft weapons and gather stones for an SOS sign. I mean, how else is rescue going to find you?

While wondering the island you learn a few things, food is scarce, resources and equipment are hard to come by and nothing is what it seems.

As night falls and a breathtaking sunset fills the sky, a weird mist seems to roll in off the coast. From the mist you see these things emerge. Human like figures stagger, crawl and sprint towards you. You don't know what you are about to face, do you fight or flee?

Game Play

Players take turns moving their pawns around the island and using action points. They use these points to collect food and resources. Using a crafting system you can make weapons and tools to help you survive.

The game is played over the course of a Day and Night rounds. In the day rounds, You can wonder freely, but when night comes around, your actions are limited as well as your movement. With the setting sun, you will also start spawning numerous Cannibals around the island on specifically designated spawning locations.

You can either fight Cannibals by rolling die, or run around them. By day break, cannibals will disappear into the forests until next night fall. As you finish your SOS sign, the island and cannibals will become more aggressive. Get off the island quick, but don't leave yourself vulnerable.

The goal of the game is to get off the island alive and with as many people as possible. It is possible to be left behind, but the game is easier if you work together.
169693.name: Cannibal Squares

169694.name: Demon~marked
169694.description:
publisher blurb

Demon~marked is a Role Playing Game set in the fantastic world of Grama. It’s built to be a low-magic and dark-fantasy kind of game, although it has a serious touch of epic-fantasy in it, since the Players will impersonate a Demon~marked.

The manual contains a set of basic rules, with simple mechanics for actions and combat. The game is played only with white and black D6 and with very limited calculations. These quick mechanics are build to favor story-telling, exploration, and talks between the Master and the Player.

Demon~marked is the first adventure set in the world of Grama; this manual contains a brief set of instructions for the Player, and short but complete directions for the Master on how to run the adventure and the scenes, plus enemies templates for the inevitable combat scenes. There are also a couple of pregenerated Characters, to begin to play immediately.

Demon~marked is a game for two players: one Player will impersonate the Character (the Demon~marked) while the other will be the Master, running the game mechanics, the world events, all NPCs etc. in a classic RPG way.

All the beautiful artwork is from Jörn Zimmermann.

169695.name: If My Heart Had Wings
169695.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

If My Heart Had Wings is an animated visual novel that tells the tale of a refreshing yet bittersweet youth story. With elements of both romance and comedy, play as Aoi Minase as he meets female companions, working with them to revive the Soaring Club in order to realise their dream.

169696.name: Spells of Doom: Alternative Art Promo Cards
169696.description:
This is a special promo pack with alternative artwork for cards included in the base game of Spells of Doom.

These cards are:
2 copies of Summoning (Magie's skill card)
2 copies of Summoning (Hypnor's skill card)
2 copies of Fast Attack (Magies's skill card)
2 copies of Fast Attack (Oakheart's skill card)

169697.description:
The day that you have been waiting for has come. At last, you can prove that you are worthy of being a member of the Hero‘s council. Show them your skills by collecting the golden monster teeth. But be aware - the lands of Taora are not as peaceful as they seem. Rumor has it, that in the dark and gloomy Netherworld, some friends become enemies...

Now get up and hurry! The Heldentaufe already started. Be the first who returns the teeth of glory.

The unique experience of Heldentaufe arises due to two distinct but connected realms: The Upper world and the Netherworld. Heroes can travel back and forth to the separate worlds through so-called "portals".

Events and activities taking place in the Upper world are mostly serene and peaceful. You will harvest natural goods, carry out missions and trade items that you find. Somewhere hidden in the Netherworld lies a bright and shiny treasure. But what underworld would be complete without monsters and traps?

Players will change perspective frequently since they not only have to tell their hero which move to make next, but also command the monsters in the Netherworld, as soon as an opponent enters the dark realm. In a game with three or four players, forging an alliance to increase a player's odds in combat against monsters can be a smart choice. However, players should choose their swordmates wisely - once unearthed, the treasures of the Netherworld might lead even their most trusted allies to suddenly turn against them...

Due to the two distinctly different worlds, both aggressive warmongers and pacifistic characters will embrace the gameplay of Heldentaufe.

Heldentaufe is easy to learn and lets you experience all the key elements of a true adventure role-playing game (discovering treasures, collecting items, completing missions, and battling monsters).

A game for tactical players who can count on their luck in critical situations.
169697.name: Heldentaufe

169698.name: Wizard Battle
169698.description:
Wizard Battle is a competitive strategy game for two or more Wizards and one Wizard Overseer, who runs the game. Dominate other Wizards in the field of Wizard Battle through your magical and mental might! Battle takes place over a series of turns in which Wizards privately perform their actions, all the while engaging in secret diplomacy with one another; cunning and ruthlessness will get you everywhere. All consequences are described simultaneously by the Overseer, as every Wizard can watch their fate - good or bad - unfold. But it's not set in stone, as time manipulating magics allow diabolical flexibility. Ultimately, at the end of the Wizard Battle, the Wizard not yet blown to pieces or driven insane wins access to the Wish spell and the title of #1 Wizard!

Features:


Outwit your opponents for the title of #1 Wizard and access to the Wish spell.
Game-play completable in 30 to 60 minutes.
Easily playable anywhere, including online, because there are no physical pieces.
15 different spells to cast, plus the option to stab your opponents, or take a nap.
Time travel to previous turns to change your actions.
Diplomatic gameplay where you make or break alliances as you need.
Optional rules to mix things up further, including a multi-game Wizard Tournament.
Playable against Satan for the rights to your immortal soul.

169699.name: Craft the World

videogameexpansion.223458: Craft the World - Sisters in Arms

169699.description:
Craft The World is a unique sandbox strategy game, the mix of Dungeon Keeper, Terraria and Dwarf Fortress. Explore a random generated world populated by dangerous creatures, build a dwarf fortress, gather resources, and craft all the items, weapons, and armor you need.

Source: The Publisher Website.

169700.name: Instant Dungeon
169700.description:
You know the feeling, you just got home from another grueling day at the office, or you're stuck at the airport for yet another layover, or maybe you just got dumped again! You just want to relax and enjoy yourself for a change.

What you need is some serious deep dungeon delving. But you don't have time for memorizing complex skill trees, crafting charts, or upgrade scales. That's not to mention sitting through ceaseless cut scenes, endless dialogue trees, or boring tutorials.

No worries! Instant Dungeon has got you covered! Just choose from one of the six unique flavors, press go, and presto! Instant dungeon will instantly create a new dungeon just for you! Complete with glittering treasures, vicious monsters, brutal boss battles, wild power ups and most importantly fun, Fun, FUN!

Instant Dungeon! mixes dungeon exploration with arcade action in the vein of the classic maze games from the 80s (eg. Pacman, et. al.).

Source: The Publisher Website.

169701.name: A.I.M. Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem
169701.description:
Every government needs a secret team for spying, hacking and destruction
A.I.M:- Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem

Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem are a team of special agents with a variety of skills and talents. Different combinations of the A.I.M. team are deployed for different mission.

Your mission, should you decide to accept it, will be to defeat all the challenges thrown at you and save the world.

In A.I.M. you play a secret “off the books” government agency who are given deniable missions to achieve.
